channel.title: Creating a bot
channel.description: Would anyone with experience in java want to team up with me in creating a bot for a 2006 runescape private server? It's emulating the good times, back in the day where you used to rush home from school to play with your friends, as in no extra gold, no extra experience and so fourth. I'm pretty stoked about this server because I remember the good times of my childhood where I played this beautiful game with my friends :D.

item.title: Creating a bot
item.dc:creator: @Flamingo3000 Flamingo3000
item.description:
@Flamingo3000 wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:6, topic:442379”]As far as I’m aware the current moparscape client has Aryan (a popular bot from around that time) built in, meaning you’d actually only need to write scripts which is far easier to learn and far less time consuming.

Alternatively you could use SIMBA, the SCAR replacement and just write colour clicking scripts. As private servers have no rules about botting or detection techniques you are not limited to how basic your script can be nor how inaccurate it is. (IE if it gets stuck it’s not like you’re going to get banned) so for this reason I imagine writing scripts for a private server is a fantastic learning experience.

All the resources you need should be somewhere around these forums, if you opt to try Simba, the SRL forums are another great resource of information.[/quote]

Oh well, I am pretty sure that botters will be banned here. They are emulating the servers as they were, and botting will not be acceptable. I do however still have no clue as to even get started writing a script, and I don’t know the first thing about programming

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a bot
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

As far as I’m aware the current moparscape client has Aryan (a popular bot from around that time) built in, meaning you’d actually only need to write scripts which is far easier to learn and far less time consuming.

Alternatively you could use SIMBA, the SCAR replacement and just write colour clicking scripts. As private servers have no rules about botting or detection techniques you are not limited to how basic your script can be nor how inaccurate it is. (IE if it gets stuck it’s not like you’re going to get banned) so for this reason I imagine writing scripts for a private server is a fantastic learning experience.

All the resources you need should be somewhere around these forums, if you opt to try Simba, the SRL forums are another great resource of information.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a bot
item.dc:creator: @Flamingo3000 Flamingo3000
item.description:
@Flamingo3000 wrote:

Greeny:

I think I know what you mean, just sort of bot up to certain stats then play it out from there… fair enough.

That is sorta the idea, not quite, but sorta - the problem though is that I have no experience in java programming, and every time i try to read up about it I get stuck after 5 mins and can’t concentrate about it, I can’t grasp the ideas.

Read full topic

item.title: Creating a bot
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

I think I know what you mean, just sort of bot up to certain stats then play it out from there… fair enough.

item.title: Creating a bot
item.dc:creator: @Flamingo3000 Flamingo3000
item.description:
@Flamingo3000 wrote:

[quote=“Greeny, post:2, topic:442379”]I feel inclined to ask why you’d want a bot if you’re looking to enjoy the game in the traditional sense.

Did you rush home from school to start the bots going then go and do something else? :P[/quote]

Haha, I completely understand and respect your opinion - back in the day, no, I did not bot. This time around I would like to not spend all of my time skilling. I cannot fully explain my logic to you, because my logic isn’t logical. I want to enjoy the game and play it, but I also want to bot. :rolleyes:

Read full topic
